column2: OK DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column8: Yield

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 3. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Turn on your emergency lights.

column2: 4. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column6: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column10: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column2: 5. Never make a U-turn from:
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 6. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column8: Crash-Prevention Driving

column2: 7. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column6: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.
column8: in an exit lane.

column2: 8. This signal means:
column8: Proceed

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column10: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 10. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column6: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.
column8: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.

column2: 11. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

column2: 12. If you arrive at an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as another vehicle:
column4: the car on the left has the right-of-way.
column6: the car on the right should yield to the car on the left.
column8: any vehicle already in the intersection should yield to the car on the right.
column10: the car on the left should yield to the car on the right.

column2: 13. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column8: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Keep right

column2: 15. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column6: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column8: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.

column2: 16. You arrive at the same time as another vehicle at an intersection has no traffic signs or signals. You should:
column4: drive through the intersection and make the other vehicle stop.
column6: slow down and yield to the vehicle on the right.
column8: speed up and get through the intersection.
column10: sound your horn and drive through the intersection with extreme caution.

column2: 17. Traffic signs and pavement markings must be:
column4: followed only when a police officer is present.
column8: used as a guide only.
column10: followed only when other vehicles are present.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column8: Trucks have the right of way

column2: 19. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: No one.

column2: 20. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a sharp turn.

column2: 21. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 22. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 23. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: A side road merges from the left
column8: Steep grade ahead
column10: The road ahead curves right, then left

column2: 25. When they see this sign, drivers:
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column10: should not speed up or brake quickly.
